results.title: The Navigator: A Medieval Odyssey (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Arenafilm, New Zealand Film Commission, John Maynard, Gary Hannam and Vincent Ward
results.brief_description: The Navigator is remarkable because of its absorbing story that links medieval fears and fortunes to our times , while confirming director Vincent Ward as an original talent. It is Cumbria 1348, the year of the Black Death. A young visionary tells his fellow miners that their community may survive the plague if they place a spire on a distant cathedral before dawn. So, from their own grim, snowbound Lake District, they dig down an old mine-shaft to the other side of the world, emerging in an Eastman-coloured present day Auckland,
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arenafilm, New Zealand Film Commission, John Maynard, Gary Hannam and Vincent Ward

results.title: The Natural
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Delphi II, Mark Johnson and Barry Levinson
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bernard Malamud, “The Natural” is one of those heroic, feel good, fairy tale films that captures the human spirit. It is a tale of boyhood dreams, of a certain defiance to turn the dream into reality and become a legend and a superhero in that passionate game of American games, baseball, and of a chance encounter with a mysterious woman that will eventually and catastrophically shatter those very dreams. Robert Redford plays the quiet and unassuming middle-aged Roy Hobbs who at the age of 14 hand-carved his own baseball bat from a tree struck down by lightning on the farm where he lived. It was Roy’s dream to play baseball in the major league and it would be his “wonder boy” bat many years later that would take him to stardom and the major league team, the New York Knights. But like all fairy tales, where good and evil battle it out, Hobbs has his own demons to deal with in the form of knockers, corruption and those who would wish to see him, and the New York Knights, fail. The story climaxes to a tense and spectacular final sequence as our hero takes the bat in a nail-biting challenge to win the pennant for his Knights. This is not a film to be taken too seriously and there are many holes in the plot, but it features a wonderful cast including Glenn Close, Kim Basinger, Robert Duvall, Barbara Hershey, Richard Farnsworth and an uncredited appearance by Darren McGavin.

results.title: The Naked truth = Your past is showing
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions and Mario Zampi
results.brief_description: A satire of the tabloid-press industry, “The Naked Truth” focuses on a scandal-sheet publisher, Nigel Dennis, who gets rich by disclosing lurid details of the private lives of wealthy prominent people. Several of his victims attempt to do away with the blackmailing publisher, all to no avail. But when they all join forces, the final plan is brought into play, with each piece slowly falling into place. Cast includes: Dennis Price, Peter Sellers, Terry-Thomas, Shirley Eaton, Peggy Mount, Georgina Cookson, Joan Sims and Miles Malleson.

results.title: The Naked kiss
results.creator_credit: Allied Artists Pictures, Leon Fromkess, Sam Firks and Samuel Fuller
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Samuel Fuller “The Naked Kiss” is a low-budget, tabloid melodrama. Its main character, a prostitute, wants to change her ways and ends up working in a hospital helping the handicapped. This moralistic and exploitative film is a unique look at outcasts showing the harsh realities that exist behind a seemingly civilized society. Outrageous in its time “The Naked Kiss” is a strange mixture of the moralistic and the perverse existing in suburbia. Cinematography by Stanley Cortez. Cast include Constance Towers, Anthony Eisley, Michael Dante and Virginia Grey.

results.title: The Naked Country
results.creator_credit: Naked Country Productions, Filmways, Ross Dimsey and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the Morris West novel, set in spectacular scenery in the Northern Territory. John Stanton plays a station-master, whose inland journey involves him in a nightmare of violence, intrigue, tribal law and double-dealing. Directed by Burstall in his usual purple manner: plenty of gore, sex and colourful scenery. Cast includes John Stanton, Rebecca Gilling and Ivor Kants.

results.title: The Music man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Morton Da Costa
results.brief_description: A con artist arrives in River City, Iowa with the intention of duping the townspeople into forming a marching band and acquiring band equipment and musical expertise from him - at a price. He does not have a musical bone in his body however, so the band is unlikely to reach fruition. His plan begins to unravel when he falls for Marion (Shirley Jones), a librarian living in River City. This is the rather simplistic plot that provides a backdrop to the many song and dance routines. Robert Preston reprises his Broadway role as con artist “Professor” Harold Hill. Shirley Jones plays the role performed on stage by Barbara Cook. Includes hits such as “Ya got trouble”, “Till there was you”, “Marion the librarian” and “Seventy six trombones”. Cast also includes Buddy Hackett, Hermione Gingold and Paul Ford. The tape also includes a documentary about the making of ‘The Music man’ - “Right here in River City: the making of ‘The Music Man’”, as well as the original theatrical trailer and an introduction by Shirley Jones.

results.title: The Muppets take Manhattan [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, David Lazer and Frank Oz
results.brief_description: Kermit and his Muppet theatrical troupe attempt to stage a musical on Broadway, but are shunted around by unscrupulous producers. In desperation the Muppets each go their own way to make a living but reunite when a young producer discovers their script. Kermit, however, comes down with a case of amnesia and emerges as an agency big shot. Miss Piggy, jealous of Kermit’s friendship with a waitress, karate chops him back to reality and it’s “On with the Show”.

results.title: The Muppet movie
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, Jim Henson and James Frawley
results.brief_description: Kermit the Frog has finally hit the big time and he’s heading for Hollywood. With his fellow Muppets including Miss Piggy, Gonzo, Animal, Fozzie Bear, plus the rest of the Muppet Performers, they encounter real life stars along the way. Kermit begins his journey on a humble bicycle, but as the passengers accumulate along the way his means of transport increases in size. Kermit also has to contend with the slimy Doc Hopper who is eager for Kermit to promote fried frog legs, as well as his strong feelings for Miss Piggy. Features a number of cameos as well as paying homage to several classic films.

results.title: The Mummy returns
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Alphaville, James Jacks, Sean Daniel and Steven Somers
results.brief_description: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and Arnold Vosloo return to star in this sequel to the 1999’s blockbuster, ‘The Mummy’. When evil mummy Lord Imhotep is resurrected in a British museum, Rich and Evie O’Connell develop feelings of deja-vu. The situation worsens when their son Alexander discovers the ancient arm bands belonging to the Scorpion King and puts them on, which will awaken the Scorpion King and bring forth the end of the world. When Imhotep discovers the wearer of the bracelets and the only thing standing in his way of reigning again is a child, he arranges for the child to be kidnapped, leaving Evie and Rich only days to save their son and the world from Imhotep and the Scorpion King. Cast also includes wrestling star The Rock, AKA Dwayne Johnson, as the Scorpion King.
